doc.field: Snow and ice hamper clean-up after hurricane Lothar
Snow and icy roads obstructed traffic in most parts of Baden Wuerttemberg. Up to 40 cm of fresh snow fell in the Black Forest. This also hampers the clean-up after hurricane Lothar.
Possibly investigations against Kohl because of donations affaire

An investigation against former CDU president Helmut Kohl because of not declared party donations is coming closer. This evening, the prosecution has not yet decided whether to start investigations. A spokesperson for the prosecution said that any [circulating] information about imminent investigations did not originate from the prosecutor's office.
Nuclear fuel containers need new coating

Nuclear fuel casks (CASTORs) in the intermediary storage facility in Ahaus are rusting. Now, they must be sanded and get a new coat of paint. The economics ministry of North Rhine-Westphalia stated that there was no danger for the painters.
Extra pay for work on Sundays to remain tax-free

The extra pay for work at night, on Sundays, and on public holidays is to remain tax free. Spokespersons of SPD and Buendnis90/Gruene said the government parties had always rejected the taxation of this extra pay.
Gasoline and diesel prices increase significantly
The prices per litre for gasoline and diesel are now just under 2 DM. Gas increased by 0.04 DM, diesel by 0.05 DM. In addition, there will be a 0.07 DM eco-tax as of January 1, 2000.
Police apprehend two teenage burglar gangs

Police have apprehended two gangs of burglars. One group had seven members and was headed by a 12-year-old. The other gang consisted of five boys aged between 14 and 17 years. The teenagers allegedly burglarized apartments and shops in series.
Police search for escaped prisoner in Brandenburg
An escaped prisoner is searched in Brandenburg. A 29-year-old murderer did not return to the Brandenburg-Havel prison after his prison holiday. The man is considered dangerous.
